items.title: First Brands Founder James Says Lenders to Blame for Bankruptcy
items.summary: First Brands founder Patrick James asked a judge to dismiss a lawsuit accusing him of misappropriating hundreds of millions of dollars, contending firms that provided his company with off balance-sheet financing engaged in “predatory” practices that helped tip the auto-parts supplier into bankruptcy.

items.title: India set for real GDP growth of 7.5% as inflation stays cool: Axis Bank chief economist Neelkanth Mishra
items.summary: Axis Bank chief economist Neelkanth Mishra projects India's real GDP to grow 7.5% in the next fiscal, driven by reforms and supportive policies. Headline inflation is expected to remain within the RBI's comfort zone around 4%, with the central bank likely maintaining a softer monetary stance.

items.title: Poor air quality may keep many tourists out of Delhi
items.summary: Several countries including Singapore, UK and Canada have issued advisories for their citizens in India. Rising pollution levels in North India are causing concern among international travellers. Travel agents are adjusting itineraries, with some tourists shortening stays or skipping Delhi-NCR. This situation impacts India's tourism image during a peak travel quarter.

items.title: SBI rejigs MD portfolios after Ranjan's elevation
items.summary: State Bank of India's chairman CS Setty has reshuffled top management portfolios following the arrival of new MD Ravi Ranjan. Ranjan will now oversee risk, compliance, and stressed assets, while Rana Ashutosh Kumar Singh takes charge of international banking, global markets, and technology. The changes aim to streamline operations and leverage expertise across key banking functions.

items.title: Britannia will move to a culture sans hierarchy: New MD
items.summary: Britannia Industries welcomes Rakshit Hargave as its new Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer. Hargave aims to foster an open, hierarchy-free work environment and will travel extensively. Subhashis Basu joins as Chief Business Officer - Dairy, leading the joint venture with Bel SA. This transition follows Varun Berry's departure after a successful 13-year tenure.

items.title: ET Graphics: A new job framework for rural India
items.summary: Rural development minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan introduced the VB-G Ram G Bill, 2025, in the Lok Sabha, aiming to replace the MGNREGA, 2005. This proposed legislation signifies a significant shift in rural employment and livelihood strategies. The Economic Times is examining its implications for stakeholders and the rural landscape.

items.title: Prestige shelves Lutyens' plan, sells bungalow
items.summary: Prestige Group has exited a luxury project deal in Delhi's Kasturba Gandhi Marg. Delays in approvals led the Bengaluru-based developer to sell the property. The group acquired the land for approximately 300 crore and sold it for around 450 crore. Prestige Group will now focus on its NCR projects in Ghaziabad, Noida, and Gurgaon.

items.title: Kotak Mahindra Bank revamps microfinance play, cuts JLG exposure amid cyclical stress
items.summary: Kotak Mahindra Bank is restructuring its microfinance portfolio, significantly reducing joint liability group (JLG) loans to focus on individually underwritten loans. The bank aims to rebuild its microfinance book to previous levels, cautiously expanding to manage the cyclical nature of the business. Early indicators for its new underwriting model are encouraging, with improved collection efficiency.

items.title: Unusual impact of silver's rally: No silver lining for mithai
items.summary: Prices of vark, the edible silver leaf used to garnish mithai, have doubled this year to around Rs 1,400 for 150 sheets, forcing confectionery makers to drop the shimmer from bestsellers like kaju katli and turn to pistachio and saffron toppings. Its demand, meanwhile, has dropped 25-30% from Rakshabandhan through the just-ended wedding season.

items.title: Unusual impact of silver's rally: No silver lining for mithai
items.summary: Prices of vark, the edible silver leaf used to garnish mithai, have doubled this year to around Rs 1,400 for 150 sheets, forcing confectionery makers to drop the shimmer from bestsellers like kaju katli and turn to pistachio and saffron toppings. Its demand, meanwhile, has dropped 25-30% from Rakshabandhan through the just-ended wedding season.

items.title: The smoke, the crowd...why the rich are heading out of cities
items.summary: The wealthy are moving away from cities. They are buying large homes in places like Goa and Alibaug. This is for cleaner air and less crowded living. Hybrid work makes this lifestyle possible. Developers are responding with more low-rise and plotted developments. These properties offer seasonal living solutions. Demand is rising for these homes.

items.title: Government plans credit guarantee scheme to ease MFI stress
items.summary: The scheme would encourage banks to lend to microfinance institutions (MFIs), especially the smaller ones, which are facing liquidity crunch amid limited access to bank funding. An announcement to this end is likely in the 2026 budget, people cited above said. The likely size of the guarantee programme is not known.

items.title: There aren't many balls left for JioStar to make the runs
items.summary: Despite strong viewership and competitive on-field performances by India, the anticipated commercial upside from marquee ICC events has failed to materialise at scale. Tournaments such as the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024 and the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 delivered healthy audiences, but advertising and subscription revenues fell short of internal expectations, says industry executives.

items.title: NCLT approves Vedanta’s demerger plan
PM Modi calls for doubling bilateral trade with Jordan in five years
items.summary: India and Jordan are set to significantly boost trade. Prime Minister Narendra Modi and King Abdullah II are targeting $5 billion in bilateral trade within five years. Both nations will collaborate on infrastructure projects, particularly in Syria. Opportunities abound in digital infrastructure, IT, healthtech, agritech, and renewable energy. Jordanian companies are invited to invest in India's vast market.

items.title: Rupee breaches 91 level, turns weakest Asian currency in 2025
items.summary: With India’s growth strong and inflation contained, policymakers may be ‘comfortable’ allowing some depreciation, currency experts opined

items.title: SC backs DMRC decision to select Indus Towers
items.summary: In a landmark ruling, the Supreme Court has affirmed the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation's decision, paving the way for Indus Towers to roll out 5G services along the Airport Metro Express Line. The court dismissed Crest Digital's challenge, although their opportunity to reapply for coverage remains intact, subject to DMRC's evaluation.

items.title: Brazilian Carrier Azul Will Turn Profit in 2026 After Bankruptcy
items.summary: Brazilian budget carrier Azul SA, now backed by United Airlines Holdings Inc. and American Airlines Group Inc., expects a bankruptcy-triggered reduction of debt and a slew of renegotiated aircraft leases to help it generate a profit the next two years.

items.title: Govt, DGCA view sought on plea over pilot duty rules exemption
items.summary: In a bold move, pilot associations have approached the Delhi High Court with contempt petitions. They argue that the civil aviation ministry and DGCA have given airlines a pass on new flight duty regulations, a decision that potentially jeopardizes both cockpit vigilance and the safety of passengers.

items.title: 131 flights cancelled at Delhi aiport due to low visibility
items.summary: The northern parts of India, including Air India's primary hub Delhi, experience low visibility due to dense fog with a potential to have a cascading impact on flight schedule across the network.

items.title: AI 'Humanity's Most Powerful Force', Says Google DeepMind Executive
items.summary: Manish Gupta also underlined that India is in the frontline of using AI to solve real-world, tangible problems.

items.title: Reliance eyes Jio-style disruption in genomics with sub-Rs 1,000 tests
items.summary: The energy-to-retail conglomerate is leveraging Strand Life Sciences for its entry into the emerging areas of specialised healthcare diagnostics and genomic sciences. Reliance had acquired the Bengaluru-based company for ₹393 crore in 2021.

items.title: JSW Energy to set up wind turbine blade units in Karnataka & Gujarat
items.summary: These units will be manufacturing wind turbine generators (WTGs) for JSW Energy as well as for its partner China's Sany Renewable Energy. The companies had entered into a technology licensing agreement last March.

items.title: CCI Clears Crypto Platform Coinbase's Minority Stake Purchase In DCX Global
items.summary: The development came after Coinbase Global in October announced that it had made an investment in CoinDCX, a leading crypto exchange in India and the Middle East.

items.title: Smartphone Shipments To Shrink 2.1% Globally As Input Costs Pile Up: Report
items.summary: Low-end smartphones will suffer the most "severe" impact due to the surge in input costs, a Counterpoint Research report said.

items.title: Falling rupee driving Indian investors to allocate funds into global markets; Tesla, Nvidia, Apple top portfolio picks
items.summary: The Indian currency has weakened against the US dollar at a steady pace for more than a decade, losing roughly 3% per year. This slow but persistent depreciation has made global capital markets exposure relevant for the Indian investors

items.title: Pakistan's Water Woes Deepen: Taliban's Kunar Dams Threaten Flows After India Suspends IWT
items.summary: Originating in Pakistan’s Chitral region, the Kunar River flows through Afghanistan’s Kunar and Nangarhar provinces before re-entering Pakistan to join the Indus River system.

items.title: Gen Z Travel Bookings Zoomed 650% In 2025, Says Cleartrip Report
items.summary: Gen Z travellers opted for multiple destinations and year-round experiences, with Dubai, Kuala Lumpur, and Bangkok

items.title: Hotels, restaurants, pubs under FSSAI's intense scrutiny over adulterated paneer
items.summary: Food regulator FSSAI has directed states to take strict action against eateries serving adulterated paneer, with potential license cancellation and unit closure. This intensified surveillance aims to trace adulteration sources and illegal supply chains, following a nationwide crackdown revealing fake paneer made from starch and oil.

items.title: 'Psychological Safety' A Key Factor In AI Initiatives For 83% Business Leaders, Says Infosys-MIT Report
items.summary: Employees often hesitate to experiment, challenge norms, or lead AI projects due to fear of criticism. This reluctance slows innovation and hampers AI adoption aimed at boosting productivity.

items.title: IPL 2026: From KKR, CSK To RCB, SRH — Check Full Teams After Mini Auction
items.summary: The upcoming edition of the Indian Premier League will be held in the March 26 to May 31 window.

items.title: SEBI Launches Rs 18.14 Crore Recovery Against ‘Baap of Chart’ For Unregistered Advisory
items.summary: In September, the Securities Appellate Tribunal directed Padamati to remit 50% of Rs 1.2 crore he received within four weeks

items.title: Govt notifies Rs 7,280-crore scheme to manufacture rare earth magnets in India
items.summary: India is launching a major initiative to boost its manufacturing of rare earth permanent magnets. The government has approved a Rs 7,280 crore scheme to build domestic production facilities. This move aims to reduce reliance on China for crucial components. These magnets are vital for electric vehicles, electronics, and green energy sectors.

items.title: Kaynes Tech Partners With Japanese Firms For Backend Chip Tech, Raw Material Supply
items.summary: Kaynes Semicon Pvt., a wholly owned subsidiary, signed deals with AOI Electronics Co. and Mitsui & Co.

items.title: Brokerage bullish on wealth management firm as India’s HNI base expands

The brokerage sees a long growth runway driven by strong client traction, acquisitions and expansion across alternative investments.

items.title: OpenAI launches ChatGPT Images, its answer to Google's viral Nano Banana
items.summary: OpenAI introduced ChatGPT Images, a new feature for editing and generating visuals in its app, following Google's Nano Banana success. It promises improved efficiency in creative tasks, while raising concerns about copyright and user privacy in AI-generated content.

items.summary: The Insurance Amendment Bill protects policyholders with disgorgement powers and higher penalties, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said.

items.title: FPIs Continue Selling Spree, Sell Shares Worth Rs 2,382 Crore
items.summary: FPIs have pulled out nearly Rs 1.60 lakh crore from domestic equities so far this year.

items.title: Bombay High Court allows Hiremath siblings to include Bharat Forge shares in intra-family inheritance suit
items.summary: The ongoing inheritance suit filed by siblings Sameer Hiremath and Pallavi Swadi, children of Sugandha Hiremath, against the promoter family of the Kalyani Group took a significant turn when the court allowed the inclusion of promoter shares of Bharat Forge and Kalyani Steels into the dispute.&nbsp;

items.title: Roadmap for ethanol blending beyond 20% necessary to address concerns about existing investments, overcapacity: ISMA Chief
items.summary: With respect to SAF, the ISMA added that India had the inherent advantage of having sugar in surplus, and Indian sugarcane has the “lowest” carbon emission index in the world.

items.title: Gen Z, affordability drives India's travel boom in 2025: Report
items.summary: Gen Z travellers surged 650 per cent in 2025, hopping across multiple destinations and chasing experiences all year long, according to Cleartrip Unpacked 2025 - A recap of 'How India flew, stayed, and searched for chutti' in 2025.

items.title: Govt Notifies Rs 7,280-Crore Scheme To Manufacture Rare Earth Magnets In India
items.summary: The minimum allocation to a beneficiary will be 600 MTPA, going up to a maximum allocation of 1,200 MTPA, in multiples of 100 MTPA, as per the notification.

items.title: Major changes for the system as non-government subscribers can withdraw up to 80%
items.summary: According to a PFRDA notification, a non-government subscriber can withdraw up to 80% of fund accumulated amounting more than ₹12 lakhs from the National Pension Scheme post-retirement

items.title: Ola Electric founder Bhavish Aggarwal pares stake marginally, clears ₹260 crore promoter-level loan
items.summary: It is part of the founder’s conviction that Ola Electric should operate with zero pledge overhang

items.title: Cheaper Price, Higher Mileage? Internet Puzzled Over BPCL Petrol Stations In Bhutan
items.summary: Bhutan imports most of its motor fuel from India, yet petrol prices in the country are said to be much cheaper.

items.title: Non-Govt NPS Subscribers Get Major Flexibility Boost: Mandatory Annuity Halved To 20%
items.summary: A minimum of 20% of the APW must be utilised for purchasing an annuity that provides a periodic pension income, and the remaining balance may be withdrawn as a lump sum.

items.title: Soon, Delhiites to pre-book favourite liquor brands through mobile app
items.summary: Delhi residents will soon be able to pre-book their preferred liquor brands using a new government application. This initiative is part of the upcoming excise policy. The policy also aims to reduce liquor outlets in residential areas. The application will map stores and update stock availability. Consumers can check brand availability and pre-book their choices.

items.title: Vijay Kedia buys 9 lakh shares of SME stock Mahamaya Lifesciences in Rs 12.5 crore block deal
items.summary: Ace investor Vijay Kedia acquired a significant stake in Mahamaya Lifesciences through a block deal. He purchased nearly 9 lakh shares at Rs 140 each. This transaction highlights investor interest in the agrochemical firm. Mahamaya Lifesciences manufactures pesticide formulations and crop protection products. The company has shown strong financial growth recently. Its shares have performed well since their market debut.

items.title: Wall Street mostly flat after jobs data signal softening labor market, Pfizer drops 3.3%
items.summary: As of 10 A.M. Eastern Time, market movement was mixed.&nbsp;The S&amp;P 500 was virtually flat, the Dow Jones Industrial Average was down 0.1%, and the Nasdaq Composite was 0.3% higher

items.title: US Oil Futures Drop Below $55 A Barrel For First Time Since 2021
items.summary: Earlier in the session, global benchmark Brent fell below $60 a barrel for the first time since May.

items.title: Lok Sabha Passes seminal Insurance Bill for 100% FDI, mandates undue gain disgorgement
items.summary: Among the major changes brought about by the Bill are empowerment of IRDAI to cap the commission to be given to the agent, disgorging wrongful gain from the insurer or insurance intermediaries

items.title: Rupee slides lower, crosses 91 mark against US Dollar
items.summary: The Indian currency weakened about 30 paise to close at 91.0275 per USD against previous close of 90.73 and during the day, it tested a high/low of 90.7625/ 91.08

items.summary: Exports to UAE, China, Hong Kong, Israel also rise significantly, per govt data

items.title: ICICI Prudential AMC IPO draws nearly Rs 3 lakh crore bids, fourth largest on record
items.summary: ICICI Prudential AMC’s Rs 10,600 crore IPO drew nearly Rs 3 lakh crore in bids, led by strong global and domestic institutional demand. Robust anchor participation underscored confidence, though valuation and OFS structure suggest a steady, not explosive, listing.

items.title: Govt To Sell Up To 3% Stake In Indian Overseas Bank Via OFS; Check Floor Price
items.summary: The OFS will open on Wednesday for non-retail investors. Retail investors will be allowed to place bids on Thursday, DIPAM said.

items.title: Rupee will depreciate further, no need to panic or worry: Axis Bank chief economist
items.summary: The rupee is expected to weaken further, reaching 92-94 against the dollar by June 2027. Experts believe this is not a cause for alarm given India's strong foreign exchange reserves. Investment commitments from foreign firms and manageable balance of payments support the currency's fundamentals. Challenges stem from speculative aspects and foreign investor sentiment.

items.title: Motor insurance claims to get faster and fairer? What changes as IRDAI tightens rules
items.summary: IRDAI has tightened motor insurance claim-settlement rules, mandating transparency, board-approved policies and faster processing. Complaints have declined, AI-based assessments are being used for smaller claims, and surveyors face stricter oversight to protect policyholders.

items.title: India engaged with all stakeholders for strategy to mitigate impact of US tariffs
items.summary: The government also sought to provide relief through export promotion measures, such as the new Export Promotion Mission (EPM) which provide support and assistance to exporters

items.title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide stock market action on Wednesday
items.summary: Indian equities declined for a second straight session as persistent foreign outflows, record rupee weakness and trade deal uncertainty weighed on sentiment. Financials, IT and metals dragged benchmarks, while technical indicators signalled continued bearish momentum in the near term.

items.title: Rural jobs guarantee revamp: More days of work, greater burden for states?
items.summary: The VB G RAM G Bill proposes a rural jobs guarantee of 125 days of employment, replacing MGNREGA. The bill requires states to prepare implementation plans and is facing criticism for shifting financial burdens to states while altering the demand-driven nature of the employment guarantee.

items.title: Lok Sabha clears 100% FDI in insurance, tightens norms to protect policyholders
items.summary: An amendment bill raising FDI limit in India's insurance sector to 100% was passed by Lok Sabha. It enhances penalties for non-compliance and streamlines regulations for intermediaries, aiming to bolster policyholder protection and insurance awareness.

items.title: Tata AIA Life, Temasek buys 1.4 pc stake in SBFC Finance for Rs 161 cr
items.summary: Tata AIA Life Insurance Company and Aranda Investments, an affiliate of Temasek Holdings, on Tuesday bought a total of 1.53 crore shares, representing 1.4 per cent stake, of SBFC Finance for Rs 161 crore from Massachusetts Institute of Technology through open market transactions.

items.title: Lok Sabha clears Insurance Amendment Bill to allow 100% FDI in insurance sector
items.summary: The Lok Sabha has approved the Insurance Amendment Bill. This allows foreign companies to own up to 100 percent of Indian insurance businesses. The government believes this will bring more money into the sector and make it stronger. The bill also introduces changes to improve how insurance companies are run and to increase insurance coverage across the country.

items.title: Crypto exchange HashKey raises $207 million in Hong Kong IPO
items.summary: HashKey Group, Hong Kong's largest licensed crypto exchange, has set its initial public offering price at HK$6.68 per share, raising HK$1.61 billion ($206.96 million), according to an exchange filing on Tuesday.

items.title: Branding Edge to launch IPs for stock investors
items.summary: Branding Edge has launched a digital content vertical to simplify capital markets and healthcare topics for Indian retail audiences, aiming to deliver clear, contextual and non-sensational explainers through timeless, narrative-driven formats starting February.

items.title: Saregama to invest ₹325 crore in Sanjay Leela Bhansali’s Bhansali Productions
items.summary: The RP Sanjiv Goenka Group company has also outlined a plan to acquire a 51 per cent majority stake in the Bollywood movie studio by the financial year 2029-30.

items.summary: The government proposed the VB-G RAM G Bill to replace MGNREGA, facing Opposition protests over funding changes and Gandhi’s name removal.

items.summary: The reform will boost insurance penetration, and lead to more competition in the sector, Sitharaman said.

items.summary: PNGRB has approved draft Consumer Protection Regulations, 2025, proposing a unified grievance redressal and compensation framework for PNG, CNG, LPG and retail fuel consumers. Public comments have been invited for 30 days before final notification.

items.summary: Payments giant PayPal has filed its banking charter application with US regulators to become a bank amid a broader push for fintech and crypto companies that are seeking a licence to expand their lending operations among customers and small businesses.&nbsp;

items.summary: Company raises buyback to Rs 4,800 per share while reducing maximum shares to 6.25 lakh, record date set for December 17.

items.summary: The investment marks a significant milestone in the Group’s journey as an R&D driven enterprise focused on clean, connected and future-ready urban mobility solutions, PVNA said

items.summary: IndiGo's flight cancellations in early December caused a dip in aviation turbine fuel sales. This trend contrasts with the consistent rise in jet fuel demand over the past two years. However, other major fuels like petrol, diesel, and LPG experienced robust growth during the same period. Diesel consumption saw a significant increase, and petrol sales also rose.

items.title: Shipments to US outpace India’s overall export growth
items.summary: India’s exports to the US in November rose 22% on-year to $6.98 billion, despite the 50% tariff that Washington levies on imports from India since August. This is faster than the 19.38% growth in India’s total outbound shipments in November and 2.62% in April-November.

items.summary: This follows Modi’s call to Trump last week to review bilateral relations, global peace & prosperity

items.title: US drug policy shift? Trump administration considers easing marijuana classification — Know what it means
items.summary: President Donald Trump has said his administration is considering reclassifying marijuana from a Schedule I to a Schedule III drug. The move could ease restrictions on research and support the cannabis industry but would stop short of full federal legalisation. Political reactions remain divided as states continue to chart their own paths.

items.title: ‘Can dead economy grow at 8.2%?’: Nirmala Sitharaman hits back at Opposition, rebuts Trump’s ‘dead economy’ jibe
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman questioned why, if the economy were “dead” as claimed by the US president and echoed by the Opposition, global institutions would upgrade India’s growth forecasts and credit ratings.

items.title: Vedanta breaks apart to race ahead: What the demerger means
items.summary: The demerger is designed to create independent, sector-focused companies with their own balance sheets and leadership teams. The company management believes that this will allow each business to pursue tailored growth strategies, attract specialised investors and be valued more accurately by the market.

items.summary: The companies that received SEBI approval include Fusion CX, Orient Cables India, RSB Retail India, Lohia Corp, SFC Environmental Technologies, Turtlemint Fintech Solutions and Yashoda Hospitals

items.title: Ola Electric founder to fully release Rs 260 crore promoter pledges, to go debt-free with limited stake monetisation
items.summary: Ola Electric founder Bhavish Aggarwal has sold a portion of his personal shares. This move fully releases promoter-level share pledges amounting to Rs 260 crore. The transaction involved monetizing personal shareholding and other incomes. This action makes the founder-promoter debt-free. Promoter-group holding in Ola Electric will now be over 34 percent. The company's electric mobility business remains unaffected.

items.summary: 91 packages approved, but zero connections under GEC Phase-II

items.summary: November's four-year-high unemployment rate of 4.6% was up from 4.4 % in September. While modest by historical standards, the rising rate of unemployment will be of some concern, with the Fed already having slashed rates three times in a row this year and hinting at a higher bar for future cuts.

items.title: Vedanta Aluminium raises Lanjigarh refinery capacity to 5 million tonnes a year
items.summary: The company’s alumina production increased to record high of 2.54 lakh tonnes in November

items.title: Insurance Amendment Bill seeks to accelerate growth of sector, improve regulatory oversight: FM Nirmala Sitharaman

We have taken measures around this in the amendment ranging from better regulatory oversight, ease of compliance, insurance intermediaries to provide uninterrupted services, and so on," the Finance Minister said.

items.title: VB–G RAM G Bill 2025: What is set to change in rural jobs, wages, infra? 10 key points to know
items.summary: The VB–G RAM-G Bill proposes a major revamp of India’s rural jobs programme, increasing guaranteed work to 125 days, focusing on durable infrastructure and strengthening transparency. The government says it modernises rural employment to match today’s economy while retaining strong social protection.

items.title: IPL 2026 Auction: From Cameron Green To Venkatesh Iyer — Check Full List Of Players Sold

RBI has cut the repo rate by 125 bps since the easing cycle began in February stating that it is to support growth as inflation remained benign.

items.summary: "Allowing imports of cement from Pakistan, therefore, carried with it the additional risk in that it provides an effective cover for smuggling of contraband goods and harmful weapons and ammunition concealed in cement bags which comes in rakes and trucks, in the hands of disruptionist elements," he said.

items.title: Moneycontrol Exclusive: Govt plans overhaul of tax administration for smooth GST rollout
items.summary: The government has readied plans for a major change in India’s tax administration structure, including overhauling the Central Board of Excise and Customs (CBEC) to ensure a glitch-free roll-out of a nation-wide goods and services tax (GST).

items.title: Sensex, Nifty wobbly; Hind Zinc, SBI, Force Motors most active
items.summary: Asian Paints, SBI, Tata Motors, HUL and Maruti Suzuki are top gainers while ONGC, Axis Bank, MM, Bajaj Auto and Hero MotoCorp are major losers in the Sensex.

items.title: Uber  redBus partner with ixigo for train travellers
items.summary: ixigo, India’s leading mobile travel marketplace has announced partnerships with Uber and redBus to enable instant bookings for cabs and buses natively within ixigo trains app.

items.title: Workload in IT to come down due to AI; jobs to reduce: Genpact
items.summary: But along with that the employment growth rates have started to dip, NV 'Tiger' Tyagarajan says. The percentage addition of employees in India will not be same as past. And due to advancements, a workforce with higher skill sets is required for the IT industry, he says.

items.title: Pixel launch: Is Google Assistant's AI an assault on privacy?
items.summary: Sure, artificial intelligence can make life simpler by suggesting you places to eat, tell you weather, or even crack a joke.  The more you use it, the more it learns about your habits and preferences. The protocols pertaining to artificial intelligence, or the lack of it, make our data less secure and more vulnerable.

items.title: Up over 200% in 1 year, what's buzzing with Borosil Glass?
items.summary: Shares of Borosil Glass Works have increased threefold over the past one year as the company has posted strong revenue and EBIDTA growth over the past few quarters.

items.title: Why you should not be always chasing returns
items.summary: Most people focus on returns and chase products that offer the best returns at any point.

items.title: Jhunjhunwala-partnered fund buys stake in TFCI: What's buzzing?
items.summary: In an interview with CNBC-TV18, Satpal Arora, MD of Tourism Finance Corporation of India (TFCI), talked about the state of business and the outlook ahead.

items.title: RBI latest meeting 'diluted' its old policy framework: Nomura
items.summary: On Tuesday, the central bank surprised the market with a 25-basis-point cut to its policy repo rate, or the rate at which it lends to banks, to 6.25 percent.

items.title: Bond bull market may pause but is far from over: Expert
items.summary: The benchmark 10-year government-security yield remained stuck in 8-7.5 percent range through all of 2015 and half of 2016, moving lower to sub-7 percent only when the RBI promised in April to reduce the system's liquidity deficit. The yield may now fall more.

items.title: Scope for meaningful rate cuts going ahead: Neelkanth Mishra
items.summary: Credit Suisse' Neelkanth Mishra expects repo rate to fall to a decade low in the coming quarters. He says that beginning December the market may see a robust and widespread pick-up which may boost indices.

items.title: Tech up to a healthier world
items.summary: Sensors, 3D printed skin, wearables, reconstructed organs, revolutionized clinical trials, personalized medicine and what not – get ready for a new era of healthcare

items.title: Steel stocks rally as govt extends MIP on 66 steel products
items.summary: Stocks like Hindustan Zinc, Hindalco, Jindal Steel, JSW Steel and Tata Steel gained over 1 percent from previous close.

items.title: Endurance Technologies IPO opens: Should you subscribe?
items.summary: The Aurangabad-based company aims to mop up nearly Rs 1,162 crore (at higher end of price band) by diluting 17.5 percent stake through the issue that will close on October 7. It already raised Rs 348.52 crore through anchor investors' portion on Tuesday, the day before issue opening.

items.title: Cautiously optimistic on India; eyeing earnings revival: Sanger
items.summary: Global liquidity tailwinds are unlikely to get any better from now and that makes Arvind Sanger, Managing Partner at Geosphere Capital Management “cautiously optimistic” on the Indian markets.

items.title: Automation threatens 69% jobs in India: World Bank
items.summary: "In large parts of Africa, it is likely that technology could fundamentally disrupt this pattern. Research based on World Bank data has predicted that the proportion of jobs threatened in India by automation is 69 percent, in China it is 77 percent and in Ethiopia, the percentage of jobs threatened by automation is 85 percent," he said.
